description: The ORDER_PROC_3 table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. This procedure table has the same basic structure as ORDER_PROC, but was created as a third table to prevent ORDER_PROC_2 from getting any larger.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the order record.

columns.name: MAMMO_OUTCOME_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column stores the outcome (e.g. FP/FN/TP/FN/etc) for a mammography study. This column is used to link to the ZC_MAMMO_OUTCOME table.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


True Negative


False Negative


True Positive


False Positive 1


False Positive 2


False Positive 1 & 2


False Positive 2 & 3


False Positive 1 & 2 & 3


N/A

columns.name: OLD_RAD_STAT_C_NAME
columns.description:
This stores the category ID for the imaging study status (e.g. technician ended the exam, reading physician finalized the exam) before the order was canceled. This will only be populated for canceled imaging orders. This column is used to link to the ZC_RADIOLOGY_STS table.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Ordered


No Show


Scheduled


Arrived


Exam Begun


Procedure Started


Discontinued


Procedure Finished


Exam Ended


----- BEGIN READING PALETTE STATUSES -----


Tech Complete


Tech Revise


Resident Revise


Saved


Queued In Trans


In Transcription


Incomplete Transcription


Transcribed


Wet Read


Queued Prelim


Preliminary


Queued Needs Review


Needs Review


Revised


Queued Final


Final


Cadence Non-Imaging Order

columns.name: TRANSCRIPTIONIST
columns.description: The transcriptionist of an external order result coming through the transcription interface.

columns.name: ORDERING_MODE_C_NAME
columns.description:
This indicates whether an order is an inpatient or outpatient order. Note that Outpatient orders can be placed from an Inpatient encounter as discharge orders. This column might be blank for Outpatient orders placed prior to the creation of the IP module. This column is used to link to the ZC_ORDERING_MODE table.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Outpatient


Inpatient

columns.name: PROV_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The provider status category number for the order at the time of the extract. This item reflects the providers' viewed status of the order result message.  The amount, frequency and type of data stored in this item depends on the programming point records entered into the results message type definition in use at each facility. This column is used to link to the ZC_PROV_STATUS table.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Ordered


Open


Reviewed


Accepted w/o review

columns.name: RESULT_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The result type category number for the order, if noted. A null value indicates that it is normal order results. This column is used to link to the ZC_ORD_RESULT_TYPE table.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Table


Text


Scan


Voice

columns.name: RFL_PRIORITY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The priority level category number of a referral order, which is used to specify whether a referral order is routine, urgent, emergency or elective. This column is used to link to the ZC_RFL_PRIORITY table.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Routine


Urgent


Emergency


Elective


Two Week Wait


See Details

columns.name: REFLEX_ORDER_ID
columns.description: The order ID from which this reflex order was created.

columns.name: ORD_TRANS_METHOD_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item holds the method of transmission for a given order.  It should only be set from a property within an order transmittal rule.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Printed


Faxed


E-Prescribed


Mail Ordered


Phoned In


OTC


Vended


Internal Pharmacy

columns.name: NUM_SIG_REQ
columns.description: The number of physician signatures required to move the study status to final within the procedural applications.

columns.name: DURATION
columns.description: Duration for this procedure.

columns.name: INTERVENTION
columns.description: Intervention for this procedure.

columns.name: SIGN_ACTION_PEND_C_NAME
columns.description:
Sign action for pended order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Sign


Sign & Hold

columns.name: STAT_COMP_USER_ID
columns.description: The ID of the user who marked an inpatient procedure as 'Complete'

columns.name: STAT_COMP_DTTM
columns.description: The time and date that an inpatient procedure was marked as 'Complete'

columns.name: IS_EXT_READ_YN
columns.description:
This item indicates whether this order is for an external read of an imaging study. A null value should be assumed to be No.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: PENDDC_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Status of an order if the order is pending discontinue.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


D/C Accepted


Pending D/C


D/C Rejected

columns.name: AUTOINTK_COMPL_YN
columns.description:
This item contains whether an auto-intake has been completed for the order.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: IS_EXT_READ_YN

columns.name: RESULT_LOCATION_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item indicates which order item the result is stored.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Normal result entry


Entered in narrative

columns.name: STAND_EOW_ID
columns.description: Holds the ID number of the Standing Status In Basket message associated with this Order.  The In Basket message informs the user that a standing order exists.

columns.name: INPAT_DISC_INTER_ID
columns.description: This item stores the interval at which a standing order should be released for inpatient orders.

columns.name: INPAT_DISC_INTER_ID_FREQ_NAME
columns.description: The name of the frequency record.

columns.name: INPAT_AUTO_RLSE_YN
columns.description:
This item indicates whether child instances of a standing order should be automatically released for inpatient orders.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: LAB_CRT_CNCT_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for the contact that was created from this order. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: LAST_OVERALL_ASMT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The most recent overall mammography assessment for the order. This should be the same as the most recent value for ORDER_RAD_ASMT.ASSESSMENT_C. This column is used to link to the ZC_ASSESSMENT table.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Need Additional Imaging Evaluation


Negative


Benign


Probably Benign


Suspicious


Highly Suggestive of Malignancy


Known Biopsy-Proven Malignancy


Low Suspicion for Malignancy


Moderate Suspicion for Malignancy


High Suspicion for Malignancy

columns.name: REVENUE_CODE_ID
columns.description: The revenue code associated with the service.

columns.name: REVENUE_CODE_ID_REVENUE_CODE_NAME
columns.description: The name of the revenue code.

columns.name: UNITS_REQUESTED
columns.description: The number of units requested for the service.

columns.name: UNITS_APPROVED
columns.description: The number of units approved for the service.

columns.name: TOTAL_PRICE
columns.description: The total price of the service.

columns.name: PATIENT_PORTION
columns.description: The amount or portion the patient will have to pay for the service they are being referred for.

columns.name: AUTH_REQUIRED
columns.description: This column stores whether or not authorization is required for the service.

columns.name: NET_PAYABLE
columns.description: The net payable of the service.

columns.name: NOT_COVERED
columns.description: This item indicates whether or not the service is covered.

columns.name: PROVIDING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The provider on the service.

columns.name: COMMENT_WITH_CANCEL
columns.description: Comment entered while cancelling an order.

columns.name: SOFT_DEL_FLAG
columns.description: Soft deletion flag for order records associated with order-based transcriptions, which were deleted by the transcription soft-deletion utility.

columns.name: RESULT_TRACK_STS_C_NAME
columns.description:
This stores whether follow-up with recipients is required, in progress, or completed. This status is the per-order, see RESULT_TRACK_RECIP for individual recipient result tracking statuses.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Required


In Progress


Completed

columns.name: ORD_PHASE_OF_CARE_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item will store the phase of care for which this order was created. Example: Pre-Op, Intra-Op, PACU.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: REQUESTED_DATETIME
columns.description: The requested date and time. The items extracted to this column are populated by the Cadence Orders Interface.

columns.name: ORX_ID
columns.description: Contains an ID from Order Lookup Index. This may be populated if an order originates from an Order Panel.

columns.name: ORX_ID_ORDER_LOOKUP_NAME
columns.description: The name (.2 item) for the order panel record.

columns.name: RELEASED_INSTA_DTTM
columns.description: Stores the scheduled instant of the child order.

columns.name: LAST_SCHE_INST_DTTM
columns.description: This item stores the inpatient order's last scheduled instant.

columns.name: INTERACT_COMMENT
columns.description: Interaction override comment.

columns.name: COPY_POINTER_ID
columns.description: This object tracks order record links created when using the inpatient or ambulatory order mover utilities to move an order record. This item is populated on the source order record and points to the target order record(s) created.

columns.name: AFTER_ORDER_ID
columns.description: This column contains the After Order ID for an order after Order Transmittal.

columns.name: BEFORE_ORDER_ID
columns.description: This column contains the Before Order ID for an order before Order Transmittal.

columns.name: DIET_COMMENTS
columns.description: This column contains the Diet Comments entered for an order.

columns.name: ORD_CONDITION_FLAG
columns.description: This column contains the a Condition Flag if this is an order created from certain condition.

columns.name: COR_AFTR_FINAL_DTTM
columns.description: The date and time when the study was corrected and finalized.

columns.name: IS_HELD_ORDER_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores 1 if the order is signed and held and active


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes

columns.name: NOCHRG_EXT_RSLT_YN
columns.description:
This column returns whether the order is an external result that should not drop charges. A value of 1 returns Y. A value of 0 returns N. A null value will return null but is treated the same as 0 when dropping charges.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: IS_EXT_READ_YN

columns.name: PROTOCOL_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Contains the current status of the order's protocols. Will be used to determine how to populate the protocol work list.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Protocol Needed


Protocol Routed


Protocol Completed


Automatically Routed


Automatically Completed

columns.name: PROTCL_ASGN_POOL_ID
columns.description: If an order's protocol has been assigned to a pool, this item contains the pool ID of the assigned pool.

columns.name: PROTCL_ASGN_POOL_ID_POOL_NAME
columns.description: The name of the scheduling pool used when searching for available providers for an appointment.

columns.name: PROTCL_ASGN_PROV_ID
columns.description: If an order's protocol has been assigned to a provider, this item contains the provider ID of the assigned provider.
